snippet: Nicolás Maduro, the handpicked protégé of Hugo Chávez, won an unexpectedly close race for the presidency. His rival demanded a recount.
abstract: Nicolas Maduro, handpicked protege of Hugo Chavez, wins unexpectedly close race to serve remainder of Chavez's six-year term as Venezuela's president; thin margin of victory and possible recount called for by his opponent, Henrique Capriles Radonski, could complicate task of governing for Maduro, emboldening political opposition and undermining his stature within Chavez's movement.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz and Paula Ramón contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Nicolás Maduro, the handpicked protégé of Hugo Chávez, won an unexpectedly close race for the presidency. His rival demanded a recount.

headline.seo: Venezuelans Elect Maduro to Succeed Chávez
headline.main: Venezuela Gives Chávez Protégé Narrow Victory
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Gives Chávez Protégé Narrow Victory
